column2: Ford recalls 204
column3: 448 Ford and Lincoln crossovers for fire hazard DETROIT
column4: Oct 29 Ford Motor Co said it will conduct a regional recall of 204
column5: 448 Ford Edge and Lincoln MKX crossover vehicles to correct an issue that could cause a fire.

column2: Garmin revenue rises on demand for GPS-based fitness products Oct 29 Garmin Ltd
column3: a maker of GPS-based gadgets
column4: reported a 10 percent rise in quarterly revenue
column5: helped by strong demand for its fitness products.

column2: GM starts $63 million expansion of Michigan assembly plant DETROIT
column3: Oct 29 General Motors Co will begin construction to expand its Lansing Delta Township assembly plant in Michigan in a $63 million project
column4: the company said on Wednesday.

column2: Atlantia denies mandate to Goldman Sachs on ADR stake saleAtlantia denies mandate to Goldman Sachs on ADR stake sale MILAN Highway operator Atlantia  denied a newspaper report on Wednesday it had hired Goldman Sachs  to advise it on a sale of a minority stake in its Aeroporti di Roma unit. column2: Goodyear profit falls on weak vehicle production in Latin AmericaUPDATE 2-Goodyear profit gets boost from lower N.America costs (Adds details from conference call; analyst
column3: CEO comment
column4: updates shares)  UPDATE 2-Goodyear profit gets boost from lower N.America costs (Adds details from conference call; analyst
column5: CEO comment
column6: updates shares) Oct 29 Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co posted a 3 percent drop in quarterly profit
column7: due to lower vehicle production in Latin America
column8: particularly in Brazil.UPDATE 2-Goodyear profit gets boost from lower N.America costs (Adds details from conference call; analyst

column2: Hess quarterly net income more than doubles on asset salesUPDATE 2-Bakken production surge boosts Hess quarterly profit (Adds stock movement
column3: comments by CEO and president
column4: details on effects of drop in prices)  UPDATE 2-Bakken production surge boosts Hess quarterly profit (Adds stock movement
column5: comments by CEO and president
column6: details on effects of drop in prices) Oct 29 Oil and gas producer Hess Corp  said on Wednesday its quarterly net income more than doubled due in part to gains from recent asset sales and a production jump in North Dakota's Bakken shale formation.UPDATE 2-Bakken production surge boosts Hess quarterly profit (Adds stock movement
column8: details on effects of drop in prices)

column2: U.S. agency sues Honeywell over employee wellness testing Oct 29 The U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has sued Honeywell International Inc to stop the company from imposing penalties on employees who refuse to undergo testing under its corporate wellness program.
HP tries something new with 3D scanning computer PALO ALTO
column3: Calif.
column4: Oct 29 Hewlett-Packard Co  has taken a modest step toward re-imagining the venerable personal computer
column5: merging a 3D scanner and projector with an all-in-one PC to create a $1
column6: 899 ensemble it hopes can rekindle industry interest.

column3: Germany
column4: Oct 29 German prosecutors dropped a two-year investigation into possible breach of trust by a former regional politician and an ex-Morgan Stanley  banker over a state's purchase of a stake worth 4.7 billion euros ($6 billion) in utility EnBW.

column2: DEALTALK-Antitrust regulators face clashing missions in U.S. cigarette deal WASHINGTON
column3: Oct 29 Cigarette maker Reynolds American's proposal to buy smaller rival Lorillard Inc  presents antitrust regulators with a conundrum: Their mandate is to prevent higher prices because of mergers
column4: but U.S. public policy aims to make cigarettes more expensive to discourage smoking.

column2: MOVES-Luis Castellanos joins BNY Mellon from BofA Merrill Lynch Oct 29 BNY Mellon
column3: the world's largest custody bank by assets
column4: said it appointed Luis Castellanos as managing director for business development in BNY Mellon Wealth Management in Florida.

column2: Coca-Cola to buy 29 pct stake in Indonesian unit for $500 mln - Coca-Cola Amatil SYDNEY
column3: Oct 30 Coca-Cola Co will pay $500 million for a 29.4 percent stake in the struggling Indonesian production and distribution unit owned by Australia's Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd
column4: the Australian company said on Thursday.

column2: Hershey's quarterly sales rise 5.8 pct Oct 29 Hershey Co reported a 5.8 percent rise in quarterly net sales as demand for chocolates ahead of Halloween was stronger than the company had expected.
Verizon reasserts no plans for Internet 'fast lanes' WASHINGTON
column3: Oct 29 Verizon Communications Inc  on Wednesday reasserted that it was not planning to strike any Internet "fast lane" deals that would help some websites load faster than others
column4: in a letter to a top U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee lawmaker.
